body:
Comment 4 by **rocky.bernstein**: 
Yep. And if you put that in a block, buf and stack will get garbage collected more
easily. Or maybe change the stack := string(..) to a fmt.Println() and import "fmt" if
it isn't there already. And presto, you have something like (the deprecated?)
debug.Prinstack()! 

Simple things should be done simply; printing the callstack is useful enough that for me
it warrants a routine. 

But that said, it's a judgement call whether this warrants adding to the standard
library in non-deprecated way. 

Cheers, rocky
